content: In Greek mythology, which god is known as the ruler of the seas and brother to Zeus and Hades?

In Greek mythology, Poseidon is known as the ruler of the seas and is indeed the brother of Zeus and Hades. He is one of the twelve Olympian gods and is often depicted carrying a trident, which he uses to create earthquakes and control the ocean's waves. His domains include the sea, horses, and earthquakes.
